meanings.definition: A person who works a piece of land for a share of the crops produced.
meanings.sent1: The sharecropper harvested the corn in exchange for a portion of the harvest.
meanings.sent2: The sharecropper lived on the farm and helped grow the crops.
meanings.sent3: The sharecropper joked that the tomatoes were so plentiful, they needed a bigger basket.
meanings.sent4: The sharecropper's dedication to the fields was like a bond with the earth itself.
meanings.sent5: The sharecropper's life revolved around the rhythm of planting and harvesting.

meanings.sent1: She decided to sharecropper on the farm to earn a living.
meanings.sent2: He sharecroppered for many years before saving enough to buy his own land.
meanings.sent3: They sharecroppered together, laughing and singing as they worked the fields.
meanings.sent4: The idea of sharecroppering under the open sky appealed to her sense of freedom.
meanings.sent5: Sharecroppering taught him the value of hard work and patience.
